attributes.action: Protect those who refuse a vaccine with existing anti-discrimination laws
attributes.additional_details: On the 14th December 2020 the government stated it had no plans to force vaccinate anyone. Medical intervention should always be consensual. The government also agreed men & women should not be coerced into vaccinating against their will by way of removal of goods & services. Adding this group of people to current anti-discrimination laws would give them protection from unscrupulous corporations & Government agencies ensuring the continuation of freedom of choice.
attributes.background: I am asking the government to add men & women who chose not to take anyone or more vaccines offered to them to be given protection under law by adding this group to existing anti-discrimination legislation.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323442

While your petition calls for people who refuse Covid-19 vaccines to protected under existing anti-discrimination laws, we believe the request of the above petition has the same practical effect.
